sn4.15:1: Thus have I heard. On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta's Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika's Park. Then Māra the Evil One approached the Blessed One and addressed him in verse:[n.287] At Vin I 2 this exchange of verses is set in the Deer Park at Isipatana and immediately follows the pair of verses at4:5. A BHS parallel is at Mvu III 46-7, but the first couplet is equivalent to v.77ab.
sn4.15:2: v.476"There is a snare moving in the sky,Something mental which moves about[n.88]Antalikkhacaro paso yo yaṁ carati manaso.Spkstates: "The snare is the snare of lust(ragapasa), which binds even those who move in the sky (i.e., by psychic power)." It is more likelyantalikkhacarois intended to suggest the incorporeal nature of lust, which can propel the mind across vast distances; see vv.10b, 11b.By means of which I’ll catch you yet:You won’t escape me, ascetic!"
sn4.15:3: v.477"Forms, sounds, tastes, odours,And delightful tactile objects—Desire for these has vanished in me:You’re defeated, End-maker!"
sn4.15:4: Then Māra the Evil One … disappeared right there.sn.i.112
